1.description: First, create the blade, which will serve as the primary cutting edge of the object, positioned prominently at the front to define its sharp, functional profile. This blade is crucial as it establishes the object's purpose and is the component that interacts directly with materials, enabling effective cutting or slicing actions.

2.description: Finally, attach the handle to the base of the blade, ensuring it is securely fastened to provide a comfortable and stable grip for the user. This addition not only completes the overall structure of the knife, enhancing its usability and balance, but also connects seamlessly with the blade, allowing for effective control during cutting tasks.
